author: Guest (Guest)
title: Need Help
text: Trying to connect a BlackBerry Storm to Verizon.  Using 3.0.c, following ChrisG's lead, just modictying conf for my cell number.  Can't get it to work.  When I supply BB password, it always fails with: Need seed value is invalid.  Commented out exit on password failure and unlocked Blackberry, still fails.  Any hints on what to look at next?  Many Thanks!

author: ChrisG (Guest)
title: Speed
text: Update: changed speed to 921600 in the verizon conf file and my equipment was able to handle it.  Speed is about twice as fast as 115200.

author: ChrisG (Guest)
title: Got it to work with Verizon
text:
Thanks for your help.  I got it working with Verizon using new version 0.3a.  I am posting this comment via tethering.  Here are my hardware specs:

Laptop: Acer Aspire One A150
Blackberry: Blackberry Curve 8330 v4.5.0.77 (Verizon)
Linux: Ubuntu Intrepid 8.10 kernel 2.6.27-7
Connection: USB

Terminal Command: sudo python bbtether.py verizon -m

Here is the working verizon conf file.

lcp-echo-failure 0
lcp-echo-interval 0

#nodetach
#debug debug debug

connect "/usr/sbin/chat -f conf/verizon-chat"
replacedefaultroute
show-password
115200
crtscts
noipdefault
ipcp-accept-local
defaultroute
usepeerdns
novj
nobsdcomp
novjccomp
nopcomp
noaccomp
noauth
user "1234567890@vzw3g.com" #replace with your phone number
password 1234567890 #replace with your phone number


Here is the working verizon-chat file

ABORT "BUSY"
ABORT "ERROR"
ABORT "NO DIALTONE"
ABORT "NO CARRIER"
'' +++AT
'' ATZ
OK AT&F
OK ATE0V1
OK AT
OK ATS0=0
OK ATDT#777
CONNECT
~p


I have not tried the GUI yet.  Thanks again for your help and for your work on this program.

-ChrisG

author: Skweeker (Guest)
title: Alltel?
text: Just wondered if anyone has had any luck with getting this to work on an Alltel 8330? I have it working via Bluetooth on my Mac, just trying to get it to work via USB on an Ubuntu laptop. On the Mac, the phone is set up as a Sprint PCS Vision, with the #777, phone number as username, and alltel as the password. I've tried modifying the username and password in the sprint config but it isn't going for me yet. Any ideas? I can submit the output if that's required. Thanks!

author: admin
title: To chrisG
text: add "replacedefaultroute" in your ppp config gile.

author: ChrisG (Guest)
title: Thanks...
text:

I change my verizon and verizon-chat files.

#verizon
ABORT "BUSY"

Chris G:

Hi, working on tethering a BB Bold/9000 in Debian Sid. I have the barry stuff installed, but was trying to use bbtether. I have gotten the 9000 recognized as a modem from KPPP on bluetooth, but keeps dropping connection (even with constant pinging). Here is my conf file, put together from other information:

author: Kotipelto (Guest)
title: Help with Blackberry Storm 9500 in Ubuntu 8.10
text:
Hi, first of all I am grateful for your efforts in getting something like this to work.

I am currently in Ecuador and I am trying to get the app to work for Porta.

I modified the chat file and the other file and I will paste the results below, but my problem seems to be before it even gets there.

I am currently using a Blackberry Storm on Ubuntu 8.10 and I have installed Barry but never really used it. When I run the ?sudo python bbtether.py porta -v? command, I get the following...

Looking for USB devices:

File ?bbtether.py?, line 77, in __init__
bb_usb.set_bb_power(berry)
File ?/home/kotipelto/Downloads/bbtether/bb_usb.py?, line 143, in set_bb_power
device.handle.controlMsg(0x40, 0xA2, buffer, 0 , 1)
usb.USBError: error sending control message: Broken pipe


I modified the bb_usb.py file and changed the following entries:

PRODUCT_NEW_9500=0x8007 #(Storm 9500) #line 15

and

if(berry.idProduct == PRODUCT_NEW_9500): #line 74
type=?9500? #line 75

I still get the same exact problem, and I am not sure if what I changed is ok but I am trying :) (I have very little if any experience with programming)

In any regards, I was wondering if you could give me a hand with this and if there is anything else I can provide you with that may help you help me I will be glad to do so.

Best Regards,

Daniel
